item.title: BT CEO Says AI Advances Could Deepen Job Cuts: FT
item.description: BT Group Plc CEO Allison Kirkby says that advancements in artificial intelligence could deepen the job cuts that are already happening at the telecommunications firm in an interview with the Financial Times.
item.dc:creator: Yi Wei Wong

media:content.media:description: Allison Kirkby, chief executive officer of Telia AB, speaks during a Bloomberg Television interview on the opening day of the MWC Barcelona at the Fira de Barcelona venue in Barcelona, Spain, on Monday, Feb. 28, 2022. Over 1,800 exhibitors and attendees from 183 countries will attend the annual event, which runs from Feb. 28 to March 3.

item.title: China’s Biotech Moment Ignites a 60% Stock Rally That Beats AI
item.description: China’s biotechnology stocks have shaken off a four-year slump to be among the hottest performers in Asia this year and funds are tipping further gains.
item.dc:creator: Sangmi Cha, Winnie Hsu, Amber Tong

item.title: Amazon Plans $13 Billion Investment in Australia Data Centers
item.description: Amazon.com Inc. plans to invest A$20 billion ($13 billion) in Australia between this year and 2029 to develop its data-center infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Ainslie Chandler

media:content.media:description: An illuminated Amazon Web Services (AWS) logo at the Tech & Innovation Expo during the South by Southwest (SXSW) Sydney festival in Sydney, Australia, on Wednesday, Oct. 18, 2023. The event is the first iteration of SXSW to be held outside North America and is expected to attract around 27,000 visitors and inject A$24 million ($15.4 million) into New South Wales state economy, according to the government.

item.title: NASA Considers Axiom Launch Next Week Following Delay
item.description: NASA is considering a Thursday launch date for the fourth Axiom astronaut mission to the International Space Station after a repair review caused a delay.
item.dc:creator: Sam Kim (News)

media:content.media:description: SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket and Dragon spacecraft at Launch Complex 39A in NASA’s Kennedy Space Center, before the launch of Axiom Space’s Axiom Mission, in Cape Canaveral, Florida, on June 11, 2025.

item.title: Taiwan Imposes Technology Export Controls on Huawei, SMIC
item.description: Taiwan has blacklisted Huawei Technologies Co. and Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp., dealing another major blow to the two companies spearheading China’s efforts to develop cutting-edge AI chip technologies.
item.dc:creator: Debby Wu

media:content.media:description: Components of a Huawei Technologies Co. Mate X5 smartphone, including a Kirin 9000s chip fabricated in China by Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp. (SMIC), arranged in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, on Tuesday, Sept. 19, 2023. Huawei's Kirin 9000s processor supports 5G wireless speeds, TechInsights said, dispelling some of the mystery around the Chinese company's latest devices.

item.title: The Big Gulf AI Deal That's Divided the White House
item.description: What does AI dominance actually mean?
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

media:content.media:description: The White House in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, May 30, 2025. US President Donald Trump said he would be increasing tariffs on steel to 50% from 25%, saying the move would help protect American steelworkers during a visit to a United States Steel Corp. plant on Friday.

item.title: Ramp Hits $16 Billion Valuation in New Funding Round
item.description: Financial technology startup Ramp is now valued at $16 billion following a $200 million funding round, according to a person familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Emily Mason

media:content.media:description: numbers on roll of paper Photographer: stuartbur/iStockphoto

item.title: Relativity Space Said to Reverse Stock Split After Schmidt Deal
item.description: Relativity Space Inc., a maker of 3D-printed rockets, enacted a reverse stock split that has significantly diluted existing shareholders and staff, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Loren Grush, Kiel Porter

media:content.media:description: Experimental 3D printed parts at the Relativity Space Inc. manufacturing facility in Long Beach, California, US, on Tuesday, Dec. 19, 2023. The US Census Bureau is scheduled to release factor orders figures on February 2, 2024.

item.title: Neuralink Device Helps Monkey See Something That’s Not There
item.description: Elon Musk’s Neuralink Corp. used a brain implant to enable a monkey to see something that wasn’t physically there, according to an engineer, as it moves toward its goal of helping blind people see.
item.dc:creator: Ike Swetlitz

media:content.media:description: The Neuralink device on the website.

item.title: Meta's $14.3B Scale Investment, Apple's New Siri Launch | Bloomberg Tech 6/13/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde breaks down Meta’s plans to take a 49% stake in Scale AI and hire the startup's CEO, Alexandr Wang. Plus, the CEO of stablecoin network Circle discusses how the passing of the GENIUS Act could impact the payments space. And Apple targets the spring of 2026 for the launch of its revamped voice assistant Siri, as the iPhone maker plays catch-up in the AI race. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Adobe Slips After Revenue Outlook Fails to Sway AI Skeptics
item.description: Adobe Inc. shares fell the most in three months after the creative-software company gave a sales outlook for the current quarter that failed to calm investors who have been skeptical it can hold its own against AI-focused upstarts.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: The Adobe offices in San Francisco, California, US, on Tuesday, June 3, 2025. Adobe Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on June 12. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Drone Maker Airo Jumps 140% in Latest Post-IPO Debut Pop
item.description: Airo Group Holdings Inc. shares climbed 140% in their public trading debut on Friday after the company raised $60 million in an initial public offering, becoming the third company this month to more than double during its opening session.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: The New York Stock Exchange .

item.title: Google’s Plan to Buy Security Firm Wiz Gets Antitrust Review
item.description: Justice Department antitrust enforcers are reviewing whether Google’s planned $32 billion acquisition of cybersecurity company Wiz Inc. would illegally limit competition in the marketplace, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Josh Sisco

media:content.media:description: The Wiz logo on a smartphone arranged in New York, US, on Tuesday, July 16, 2024. Google parent Alphabet Inc. is in talks to acquire cybersecurity startup Wiz Inc., according to a person familiar with the matter. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Scale AI Backer Accel Set for $2.5 Billion Windfall on Meta Deal
item.description: Accel is among a handful of VC firms poised to see big returns from early bets on Scale AI.
item.dc:creator: Kate Clark

media:content.media:description: The Scale AI logo

item.title: A $60 Billion Visa, Mastercard Slump Seen as Buying Opportunity
item.description: A report that large multinational merchants are exploring ways to bypass traditional credit-card fees presents investors with an opportunity to buy shares of Mastercard Inc. and Visa Inc., according to Wall Street analysts.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Reinicke

item.title: Trump Seeks to Register His Name for Mobile Phone Service
item.description: DTTM Operations LLC, the entity that manages trademarks on behalf of President Donald Trump, has applied to use his name and the term T1 for telecom services.
item.dc:creator: Kelcee Griffis

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump greets attendees during the Congressional picnic on the South Lawn of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, June 12, 2025. Senate Republicans seeking to put their mark on the House-passed tax-and-immigration package are considering raising the state and local tax deduction cap to $30,000, lower than the House's $40,000 plan.

item.title: Centerview Is Sole Bank on Meta’s $14 Billion AI Bet
item.description: One of the largest-ever investments in a private US company has minted just one investment banking winner: Centerview Partners.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould

item.title: Indie Music’s Growing Backlash Against the State of Streaming
item.description: As the streaming model evolves, tensions are building throughout the music industry
item.dc:creator: Ashley Carman

media:content.media:description: Yuri Suzuki, partner at Pentagram Design Inc., works from his new home music studio in Margate, U.K., on Wednesday, Aug. 11, 2021. Freed from the grind of travel, Suzuki finds he is able to "invest" time in creative thinking long after formal working hours. Photographer: Jason Alden/Bloomberg

item.title: How ‘Hitman’ Developer Became One of the Largest Independent Game Companies
item.description: Eight years ago, IO Interactive was bleeding money. Now it’s one of the biggest privately owned video-game companies in the world.
item.dc:creator: Jason Schreier

media:content.media:description: The Hitman: World of Assassination compilation has sold more than 25 million copies

item.title: Ransomware Plague Targeting Hospitals Comes to Ohio
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gallagher

media:content.media:description: Demonstrators drive trucks down interstate 70 as part of a Peoples Convoy 'Freedom and Accountability' caravan in Dayton, Ohio, U.S., on Thursday, March 3, 2022. The People's Convoy have called on President Joe Biden to end vaccine and other pandemic mandates while modeling themselves after Canadian drivers who had occupied the center of Ottawa in a similar protest.

item.title: CATL Shares Clouded by Bleak Outlook After Mega Hong Kong Debut
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. has received little love following its splashy $5.2 billion listing in Hong Kong last month, as investors eye multifold challenges in the global EV battery market.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

media:content.media:description: Robin Zeng, founder and chairman of CATL, left, with Paul Chan, Hong Kong's financial secretary, during the company's listing ceremony in Hong Kong on May 20. Photographer: Paul Yeung/Bloomberg

item.title: Ships’ Electronics Increasingly Jammed Since Israel Struck Iran
item.description: Israel’s airstrikes on Iran have led to increased jamming of the signals of vessels operating in the Middle East, the world’s largest oil producing region, a multinational naval force protecting maritime trade said.
item.dc:creator: Alaric Nightingale

item.title: Micron Plans $200 Billion US Chip Spend, Chime IPO | Bloomberg Tech 6/12/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Micron’s plans to spend $200 billion on U.S. chip manufacturing and R&D. Plus, Chime CEO Chris Britt discusses the company’s growth strategy as the company goes public. And Oracle’s earnings impress investors with its rising cloud sales. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: OpenAI to Continue Working With Scale After Meta Deal, CFO Says
item.description: OpenAI said it will continue working with Scale AI after Meta Platforms Inc. made a multibillion-dollar investment in the startup, as it seeks to maintain a broad ecosystem of data sources.
item.dc:creator: Amy Thomson

media:content.media:description: The OpenAI virtual assistant logo on a laptop computer.

item.title: How the Clippers Engineered the NBA’s Best Home Court Advantage
item.description: Reward the loudest fans and make sure there are lots and lots of bathrooms.
item.dc:creator: Ira Boudway

item.title: China Boosts Tesla Self-Driving Plan With Car-Data Export Rules
item.description: Chinese authorities released draft guidelines on transmitting data from automobiles overseas, a move that could pave the way for the wider rollout of Tesla Inc.’s most advanced driver-assistance functions in the world’s largest car market.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Chunying Zhang

media:content.media:description: The dashboard of a Tesla Motors Inc. Model S car, equipped with Autopilot, is seen during a test drive in Palo Alto, California, U.S., on Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015. Tesla Motors Inc. will begin rolling out the first version of its highly anticipated "autopilot" features to owners of its all-electric Model S sedan Thursday. Autopilot is a step toward the vision of autonomous or self-driving cars, and includes features like automatic lane changing and the ability of the Model S to parallel park for you. Photographer: David Paul Morris

item.title: Abu Dhabi’s G42 Opens Europe Hub in Sign of Growing AI Ambition
item.description: Abu Dhabi’s main artificial intelligence company, G42, is launching a European unit as part of the emirate’s broader push into the continent, where the government has pledged billions of dollars in investment.
item.dc:creator: Alex Dooler

media:content.media:description: Skyscrapers and commercial buildings, beyond Tower Bridge, in the City of London.

item.title: Meta Risks Regulatory Scrutiny in Pursuit of Scale AI
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Jackie Davalos reports on Big Tech’s “acqui-hire” strategy for artificial intelligence that is drawing scrutiny from regulators.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Davalos

media:content.media:description: The Scale AI logo on a smartphone.

item.title: Big Tech Is Dealing Flat Design a Death Blow
item.description: From Airbnb’s new app icons to Apple’s “Liquid Glass” design, skeuomorphism is back and everything in the digital world has dimensionality again.
item.dc:creator: Austin Carr
